titleStmt.title: The character of the Lord Baron Ginckle, lieutenant general, and commander in chief of their majesties forces in Ireland : with a panegyrick on his lordship's conduct (this last campaign) in reducing Ballymore, Athlone, Galway, and Lymerick; and his defeating the Irish army at Aghrim, &c. De ware verbeetenis van sijn excellentie den Baron van Ginkel, luytenant-generael en commandant en chef van hare Majesteyten armées in Yrland. Met een lof-reden van sijn excellenties conduite (in de laeste campagne) in het reduceeren van Balymore, Athlone, Galoway, en Limerick. Mitsgaders het verslaen van het Yrsche leger by Agrim.

publicationStmt.publisher: by Jan Aelberts, boeckverkooper in de Hofstraet,
publicationStmt.pubPlace: Gedruckt naer de copy van Londen, in 's Gravenhage :

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
